moves.1. c4: I've started experimenting a little with the English opening with some success
moves.5... Qf5: This takes us out of the gameknot database and my next move may be why.
moves.6. e4: harrasses the queen and strengthens the centre
moves.6... Qg4: Attacking g2, preventing my lsb from moving which delays whites castling
moves.7. d5: Putting the question to one of the few pieces that black has been able to develop, the knight has few reasonable options
moves.7... Nb4: This is a mistake as it gives the knight away
moves.8. Qa4+ Bd7: takes away the defence of the b7 pawn which my queen will be attacking after taking the knight
moves.9. Qxb4: I'm still not sure if Bb5 would have been better
moves.11. Qxf8+ Kxf8 12. Nxg4 exd5 13. Nxd5: Mistake from white from this time
moves.13... Bxg4 14. Bb5: The black king is hemmed in but I don't think white is in a position to take full advantage
moves.14... Rc8: threatening a fork with b6, Rd6 looks better to me
moves.15. Ba4 c6 16. Ne3 Bd7 17. O-O Re8 18. B: Looking to get the dsb on the A3-f8 diagonal, though the potential pin from Bb2 is tempting too
moves.20... Rh7 21. Bb2 Nh5: Not an ideal place for a knight but were else could it go? Perhaps g8 then e7 would have been better
moves.22. Rad1 Be6 23. f4: Trying to keep some sort of attack going
moves.24. exf5 gxf5 25. Nxf5 Bxf5 26. Bxf5 Rhe: The fork was too tempting to resist, there is however an added benefit that the black king is held onto the 8th rank
moves.27... Rc8 28. Bxh5: I'm not sure this was neccesary
moves.28... c5 29. Be5: blocking out blacks rook from the e file, though again this move is probably not neccessary
moves.30. bxc4: The c pawn is immune due to Rd8#
moves.30... Kg8: I think black had seen the threat but didn't realise that this was not an escape route
moves.32. Rd8+:
Kh7, Rh8# to follow

Thanks for reading please comment
